spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Edwin is a 15th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following paladin spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Edwin makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, Edwin can utter a command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that he can see within 30 feet of him makes an attack roll or saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll, provided it can hear and understand Edwin. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if Edwin is {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: Whenever Edwin or a friendly creature within 10 feet of him must make a saving throw, the creature gains a +3 bonus to the saving throw. Edwin must be conscious to grant this bonus.

trait.name: Death Before Dishonor
entries: Edwin has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Sentinel
entries: When Edwin hits a creature with an opportunity attack, the creatureâ€™s speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn. Creatures provoke attacks of opportunity from Edwin even if they use the {@action Disengage} action before leaving his reach.
== Two-Note NPC ==
{@bold {@italic Purpose.}} Judge the players in court.
{@bold {@italic Trait.}} I am resolute and always put my responsibilities above anything. (Virtue)
== Angry's Four P's ==

{@bold {@italic Posture.}} Uptight with hands helf backwards.
{@bold {@italic Pause.}} Humming.
{@bold {@italic Pfidget.}} Nodding decisively.

{@bold {@italic Incentives.}}
Trusts the players: 2

reaction.name: Bodyguard
entries: If a creature within 5 feet of Edwin is hit by an attack roll, the Edwin may use his reaction to force the attacking creature to reroll their attack, potentially causing it to miss. To use this ability, the Edwin must be able to see both the creature and its attacker.
